did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: "Weaving For Victory: Weaving Today the Pattern of Tomorrow" TWUA Radio Scripts, 1943-1984
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Collection contains scripts from the TWUA radio program "Weaving For Victory" which ran from May 1943 through December 1943.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: The Textile Workers Union of America (TWUA) was an union for textile workers originally established through the Congress of Industrial Oranizations in 1939. In 1976 it merged with the Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America and became the Amalgamated Clothing and Textile Workers Union (ACTWU).

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: "Weaving For Victory: Weaving Today the Pattern of Tomorrow" TWUA Radio Scripts #6390. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.
